availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Solomon C. Perrin (Kenton Co, KY, minister, attorney, court clerk, and judge)

body.p: Covington, Kentucky, minister, attorney, clerk, judge, and politician. Kentucky native. Son of W. C. Perrin. Married to Mary J. Perrin. Father of William Josephus Perrin, Charles Perrin, and Franklin Perrin. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Harrison County in 1833 and 1836. Christian minister in Kenton County in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in 1850. Clerk of Kenton County Court from 1859 to 1862. Owned two enslaved persons in 1860. Judge of Kenton County Court in 1862.
